2000.context: Dell Technologies Inc. is a technology infrastructure company focused on PCs, servers, storage, and IT infrastructure solutions. Direct sales model leader. Consumer and enterprise PCs.

competitors.name: Compaq
competitors.notes: Global market leader in late 1990s until 2000; acquired by HP in 2002

competitors.name: Hewlett-Packard (HP)
competitors.notes: Shared market leadership with Dell in the 2000s; acquired Compaq in 2002 to create a more formidable competitor

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: One of the top three PC manufacturers alongside HP and Compaq; sold PC business to Lenovo in 2005

competitors.name: Gateway
competitors.notes: PC vendor competitor with higher operating costs (25% of revenue vs Dell's 10%)

competitors.name: Packard Bell
competitors.notes: PC manufacturer that struggled during this period

competitors.name: AST Research
competitors.notes: PC vendor that eventually left the market

2005.context: Dell Technologies Inc. is a technology infrastructure company focused on PCs, servers, storage, and IT infrastructure solutions. Expanding into enterprise with PowerEdge servers and storage.

competitors.name: Hewlett-Packard (HP)
competitors.notes: Fiercest competitor; merged with Compaq in 2002 and acquired EDS; regained PC market leadership from Dell by Q4 2006

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: One of the oldest technology companies; known for extensive R&D and innovation; sold PC business to Lenovo in 2005

competitors.name: Lenovo
competitors.notes: Acquired IBM's PC business in 2005, becoming a major competitor in PC and server markets

competitors.name: Acer
competitors.notes: Founded 1976; operates in over 70 countries with 7,900 employees as of mid-2000s

competitors.name: Samsung
competitors.notes: Diversified technology competitor in PC and consumer electronics

competitors.name: Apple
competitors.notes: Premium PC and technology competitor

2010.context: Dell Technologies Inc. is a technology infrastructure company focused on PCs, servers, storage, and IT infrastructure solutions. Acquired Perot Systems. Services business growing.

competitors.name: Hewlett-Packard (HP)
competitors.notes: Major competitor across PCs, servers, and enterprise solutions; later split into HP Inc and HPE in 2015

competitors.name: Lenovo
competitors.notes: Competitor in PC and server markets after acquiring IBM's PC division in 2005

competitors.name: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE)
competitors.notes: Key competitor in enterprise servers, storage, and networking solutions (formed from HP split in 2015)

competitors.notes: Competitor in enterprise technology, software, and hardware solutions

competitors.notes: Competitor in networking solutions, particularly in enterprise space

2015.context: Dell Technologies Inc. is a technology infrastructure company focused on PCs, servers, storage, and IT infrastructure solutions. Went private in 2013. Acquired EMC for $67B in 2015.

competitors.name: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE)
competitors.notes: Founded 2015 from HP split; major competitor in enterprise servers, storage, and infrastructure; historically sold with EMC gear

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Top competitor in enterprise storage and infrastructure alongside HPE and Cisco

competitors.name: Cisco
competitors.notes: Key competitor; was part of EMC-VMware VCE converged infrastructure partnership, affected by Dell-EMC deal

competitors.name: NetApp
competitors.notes: Major enterprise storage competitor with AI-driven data management solutions

competitors.name: Amazon Web Services (AWS)
competitors.notes: Dominant cloud IaaS competitor with 98.07% market share in cloud infrastructure category

competitors.name: Microsoft Azure
competitors.notes: Cloud infrastructure competitor with Azure Virtual Machines and storage offerings

competitors.name: Pure Storage
competitors.notes: Enterprise storage vendor with all-flash infrastructure solutions

competitors.name: Lenovo
competitors.notes: Competitor in servers and enterprise hardware

competitors.name: VMware
competitors.notes: Virtualization leader (became part of Dell Technologies through EMC acquisition)

2020.context: Dell Technologies Inc. is a technology infrastructure company focused on PCs, servers, storage, and IT infrastructure solutions. VMware spin-off. Remote work drove PC demand.
